meanings.sent1: The hyperresponsive alarm system went off at the slightest noise.
meanings.sent2: She is hyperresponsive to changes in temperature, always feeling too hot or too cold.
meanings.sent3: The hyperresponsive car alarm startled everyone when a leaf fell on the hood.
meanings.sent4: His hyperresponsive nature to criticism made him quick to anger.
meanings.sent5: The hyperresponsive baby monitor picked up even the faintest sounds from the nursery.

meanings.definition: Showing an exaggerated response to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The hyperresponsive cat jumped at the smallest movement.
meanings.sent2: The hyperresponsive student always overreacted to classroom noises.
meanings.sent3: The hyperresponsive doorbell chimed loudly for a single ant walking by.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperresponsive sense of smell could detect a hint of perfume from across the room.
meanings.sent5: The hyperresponsive smoke detector blared at the mere whiff of burnt toast.
